column2: ALABAMA DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: Alabama
column6: AL

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 2. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.
column6: by the pedestrian.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Reversible lane ahead.
column6: The divided highway ends ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 4. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn is not permitted
column6: Left turns are permitted
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 6. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Danger ahead.
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 7. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Drive with caution.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 8. To make a proper right turn:
column4: swing to the left before turning right.
column6: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.
column8: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.

column2: 9. When driving at night, if an approaching car is using its high-beams you should:
column4: look toward the left edge of the road.
column6: look toward the right edge of the road.
column8: turn your lights on and off.

column2: 10. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
column6: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.

column2: 11. You should always travel:
column4: at the speed of the vehicle behind.
column6: according to weather and road conditions.

column2: 12. When merging onto an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: always stop before entering the highway.
column6: select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.
column8: turn on their emergency flashers right before merging.

column2: 13. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Shift to a lower gear.
column6: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 14. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 15. This sign is a:
column4: regulatory sign.
column6: warning sign.

column2: 16. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 17. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.
column6: indicate no pass zones.

column2: 18. Drivers should make room for cars entering freeways by:
column4: maintaining their speed and position.
column6: moving over a lane if there is no other vehicle next to them.

column2: 19. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are not wearing safety belts.
column6: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column8: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.

column2: 20. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 21. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column6: signal the train to stop.

column2: 22. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
column4: a yield sign.
column6: a stop sign.

column2: 23. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: before you enter the intersection.
column6: at the next crosswalk.
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down or stop
column6: Stop

column2: 25. Sudden wind gusts on highways:
column4: are generally caused by dust and dirt blowing around.
column6: can cause one to lose control of their vehicle.

column2: 26. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column6: Do not enter

column2: 28. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.

column2: 29. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: white triangles.
column6: green rectangles.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column4: Railroad crossing
column6: No Passing Zone

column2: 31. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Red light
column6: Stop sign

column2: 32. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 33. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the lane you’re in.
column6: the right lane.
column8: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 34. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 35. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 36. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how fit you are.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: You have the right of way
column6: No Passing Zone

column2: 38. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly.
column6: slow down gradually and brake lightly.

column2: 39. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: blue; white
column6: white; black

column2: 40. You are driving at night, and a vehicle comes toward you with their high beam headlights on. You should:
column4: flash your headlights once quickly.
column6: look in the direction of the vehicle.
